ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: HPVHA has initiated many project focused on health and developmental issues in the state. The organisation is working the following issues. Swachh Bharat Abhiyan: HPVHA is implementing Swachh Bharat Abhiyan in all villages of Bilaspur and Hamirpur districts and Amb Block of Una districts. The organisation is focusing on the construction of individual toilets in all households and Management of Solid and Liquid Waste in the rural areas. Under HIV Prevention and Care the organisation is implementing Targeted Intervention Project, Care and Support Centre for HIV infected people. The organisation if providing preventive support to 300 Female Sex Workers and 100 Male Sex with Male in Shimla city. Through care and support services the organisation has linked more than 700 PLHIV with social security schemes. The Shubharambh project is focused on nutritional support and health services among the children and women in industrial area like Baddi. More than 3500 mothers and 1000 children are benefiting through the project. The project is supported by Mondeleze under CSR. Health Care Center Barmana is focsed on STI clinics for Truckers and allied community. The project is providing its services to more than 5000 truckers and allied community. The project is joint CSR activity of ACC and Apollo. Childline is implementing in Shimla and Solan district. The projects are focusing on child rights. More than 1000 children have been rehabilitated and rescued by both the childlines. The organisation is running a open shelter for street children and child in need.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Himalayan Research Group aims to bring economic prosperity to the local communities in an ecofriendly manner with application of scientific innovations and technology transfer. Ensuring active participation of people is the key to success of HRG programmes over the past one decade. HRG has taken several initiatives at the grass roots level ranging from community empowerment to conservation of biological diversity. Professional and motivated team of HRG has been instrumental in introducing science based entrepreneurship in rural areas of Himachal Pradesh. Mushroom cultivation, medicinal plants cultivation, aromatic plants cultivation and processing, vermicomposting, fodder cultivation and silage making, solar energy use in space and water heating, tribal development, tourism and floriculture constitute major areas of work. Hardcore research was limited to standardisation of agro technology of endangered Himalayan Medicinal Plants, fungal endophytes of Himalayan Yew, forest and horticulture diseases. Community organisation, technology training and entrepreneurship development through backward and forward linkages were promoted to sustain the activities on long term basis. Dr. Maninder Jeet Kaur, Secretary, HRG was awarded prestigious Department of Science and Technology Govt of India National Award for women development through application of science and technology 2006 on 11 May 2007 by the then President of India Dr APJ Abdul Kalam. HRG is supported by DST under their long term CORE programme for technology extension in rural areas since 2005. Main achievements of HRG activities include self sustaining models of button mushroom cultivation for development of household level micro-enterprise in rural areas and cultivation of high value medicinal plant Chirata through organised women groups for their economic empowerment. In addition model for low cost floriculture, Fodder Development, popularisation of Solar Energy use in space & water heating and lighting are equally successful. Work for linkages of agriculture and household activities with tourism in tribal areas of Kinnaur are also emerging as model for employment generation and agriculture product sale but activities are still in the early stages.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: HUMAN RIGHTS PROTECTION CELL & WELLFARE ASSOCIATION, UNA Since 2006 Human Rights Protection Cell &Welfare Association, Una is providing free legal service / counselling to individuals, societies, groups to protect their human rights. Underlying principal of the association is that rather than counting the number of cases handled, solved of Human Rights violation, our commitment should be to provide selfless / free service to all and sundry whose dignity challenged / human rights violated. During the year 30-35 cases of domestic violence, police atrocities, land disputes, social injustice, drug addiction etc. were dealt with. The opening of Village Legal Care & Support Centre by National Legal Services Authority facilitated our work to some extent. Every year on World Human Rights Day i.e., 10th Dec., a public awareness function is organized to sensitize and aware the people about their Human Rights and remedies in case they are violated. This year the Annual function was organized on 13th Dec. 2015(Sunday) so that maximum no. of people could participate. Project for Special Schools for Person with Disability Aims & Objectives To mitigate the sufferings of Special rather blessed children [Mentally Challenged, deaf & dumb (Hearing Impaired)] & their parents. Provides Services for: â€¢ Identification of Children with Special Needs (CWSNs). â€¢ Special Education & Physical training. â€¢ Discover their hidden potential â€¢ Integrate children with Special needs into main stream of Society. â€¢ To undertake special programme, activities for the education & rehabilitation of persons with disability â€¢ To work for early intervention, prevention, medical rehabilitation, placement, economic self reliance of Special Children. â€¢ Counseling to parents & Community regarding myths & misconceptions about mental retarding/physical disability. All services will be provided free of cost. Establishment of Ashhraya Ashhraya, came into existence in May 2010 with enrolment of 17 Special Children. As present it has 60 Special Children (46 mentally challenged & 14 hearing impaired) in addition to 3 Home based Special children, which is very much on target. Every year new academic session starts in April (around 15th to 18th) with Havan& Cultural function. School timings are from 09:00 AM to 01:30 PM. Children assemble at 09:00 AM Sharp for daily prayers & Physical exercise. Academics, Speech Therapy and Physiotherapy starts from 09:30 AM onwards as per specific needs of each child. Alpahar is provided at 10:50 AM. Alpahar contains Milk, Biscuits and fresh fruits as per availability. Mid day meal is served to all the children at 01:10 PM. Meal is prepared within the four walls of â€œAshhrayaâ€, which is duly checked by teaching staff on rotation before it is served to Special Children. Average attendance is 85% to 90%. Every Saturday is games/curricular activities day, special children learn art & craft, stitching, painting, music and play games of their choice. Once a week volunteers and Special children to cleaning activity to keep premises neat and clean. Every facility like Education, Speech Therapy, Physiotherapy, Physical Exercise, Transportation, Uniform, Books, Medicines etc. is provided Free Of Cost.
